Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.telemetry.protobuf

package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.telemetry.protobuf
Protocol Buffers encoding and decoding for OTLP.

This package provides a lightweight Protocol Buffers implementation for encoding and decoding OpenTelemetry Protocol (OTLP) messages without requiring the full protobuf library or generated code.

Key Components

Writing (Serialization)

  • ProtobufWriter - Writes protobuf-encoded binary data to a WritableByteChannel
  • ByteBufferChannel - A channel implementation that writes to an auto-expanding ByteBuffer

Reading (Deserialization)

  • ProtobufParser - Push-based parser that processes protobuf data incrementally
  • ProtobufHandler - Callback interface for receiving parsed field values
  • DefaultProtobufHandler - Default handler implementation with helper methods for value interpretation

Wire Format Support

The implementation supports all protobuf wire types:

  • Varint (int32, int64, uint32, uint64, sint32, sint64, bool, enum)
  • 64-bit (fixed64, sfixed64, double)
  • Length-delimited (string, bytes, embedded messages, packed repeated)
  • 32-bit (fixed32, sfixed32, float)

Push Parser Usage

 ProtobufHandler handler = new DefaultProtobufHandler() {
     @Override
     public void handleVarint(int fieldNumber, long value) {
         // Process varint field
     }

     @Override
     public void handleBytes(int fieldNumber, ByteBuffer data) {
         // Process bytes/string field
     }

     @Override
     public boolean isMessage(int fieldNumber) {
         return fieldNumber == 1; // Field 1 is an embedded message
     }

     @Override
     public void startMessage(int fieldNumber) {
         // Push nested context
     }

     @Override
     public void endMessage() {
         // Pop nested context
     }
 };

 ProtobufParser parser = new ProtobufParser(handler);
 parser.receive(buffer);
 parser.close();

OTLP Message Types

This package is used to encode:

  • TracesData - Distributed tracing spans
  • MetricsData - Metric measurements
  • LogsData - Log records

Design

Unlike generated protobuf code, this implementation uses manual encoding/decoding with explicit field numbers. This provides:

  • Zero external dependencies
  • Smaller code footprint
  • Full control over serialization
  • Incremental parsing support for streaming

Internal Use

This package is used internally by the OTLP exporter and session replication, and is not intended for direct use by application code.

Author:
Chris Burdess

  • Class
    Description
    ByteBufferChannel
    A WritableByteChannel implementation that writes to an expandable ByteBuffer.
    DefaultProtobufHandler
    Default implementation of ProtobufHandler with no-op methods.
    LogSerializer
    Serializes log records to OTLP protobuf format.
    MetricSerializer
    Serializes metric data to OTLP protobuf format.
    ProtobufHandler
    Handler interface for push-based protobuf parsing.
    ProtobufParseException
    Exception thrown when protobuf parsing fails.
    ProtobufParser
    Push-based protobuf parser.
    ProtobufWriter
    Zero-dependency Protobuf binary encoder.
    ProtobufWriter.MessageContent
    Interface for writing embedded message content.

    Serializes traces to OTLP protobuf format.
